result.execSummary:
The defendant Mareill Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: counts two and three.  Credit for six days.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions on all counts:  same as probation conditions.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a  DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Pay the $500.00 child pornography surcharge as to counts one, two and three for a total of $1,500.00.
Pay all applicable Court costs, fees, surcharges and DNA surcharges, pornagraphy surcharges.  To be paid over period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No possession of phones or computers with internet capability.
No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 16 years.

Comply with the standard rules of probation/Extended Supervision.
Cooperate and participate with a sex offender evaluation. Follow any recommended treatment.
Cooperate and particpate with any other conditions deemed appropriate by the probation department.  Follow any recommended treatment.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment.  Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.
OTHER COURT ORDERS:
Comply with the permanent sex offender reporting requirement.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: couns one and three. Credit for six days.
Concurrent with: counts one and two.  Credit for six days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mareill Harris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Invoice dated 8/31/16 from Dr. J. Pankiewicz for services performed 3/14, 3/17, 3/18, 3/15, 3/16, 2/23, and 3/19/16, in the amount $1,125.00 forwarded to Accounts Payable 9/28/16.
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; filed.

Defendant Mareill Harris in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State and defense counsel.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 17 YEARS, concurrent to Count #2 and Count #3.
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 7 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS.
Credit given for 6 days time served if revoked.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 17 YEARS, concurrent to Count #1 and Count #3.
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 7 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS.
Credit given for 6 days time served if revoked.

AS TO COUNT 3:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 17 YEARS, concurrent to Count #1 and Count #2.
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 7 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS.
Credit given for 6 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 7 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* No possession of phones or computers with internet capability.
* No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 16 years.
* Cooperate and participate with a sex offender evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with any other conditions deemed appropriate by the Probation Department and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the $500.00 child pornography surcharge as to Counts 1, 2, and 3 for a total of $1,500.00 - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Comply with the PERMANENT sex offender reporting requirement.
* The conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Mareill Harris in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 & 3:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #4 and Count #5 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
Dates changed.

Defendant Mareill Harris in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 2.

Defense counsel is to take defendant to Forensic Unit immediately after court to schedule an appointment for exam.

No challenges to the doctor's report.
Court finds defendant is competent to proceed.
Court REINSTATED the proceedings today.

Case adjourned to 11-18-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.
"Restoration" as to the defendant prepared by Dr. John Pankiewicz; filed.

Atty. John Wasielewski appeared before the clerk today.  Due to the fact that the competency restoration report will not be completed until October 18, 2015, clerk rescheduled this matter OFF THE RECORD to 10-26-2015 at 8:30 AM (a date ADA Kevin Shomin is already scheduled in this court), Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference of defendant's Competency Restoration.

Outpatient Competency Restoration Program telephoned the court to indicate that next progress report is not due until October 18; no report will be filed for the 10-08-15 review hearing.  The Court to leave review hearing set on 10-08-15 at this time.

Defendant Mareill Harris in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties acknowledge receipt of a copy of the doctor's report.   Parties do not challenge the report.  Court finds the defendant is doing well in the Outpatient Competency Restoration Program, but needs more treatment and will likely regain competency with further treatment.  Court continues defendant's placement and sets case for further review.

Per Chief Judge Directive of 15-10, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Branch 02, Judge Joseph Donald, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mareill Harris in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties acknowledge receipt of a copy of the doctor's report.  Parties do not challenge the report.  Based on the report, Court finds the defendant is not competent to proceed, but is likely to regain competency if provided psychoeducational remediation.  

COURT ORDERS defendant committed to the Department of Health Services; the proceedings are suspended; the DHS is to designate the receiving institution; the sheriff is to transport the defendant to the institution; the institution is to be provided with copies of the Information, Complaint and the doctor's report and the institution is to provide updates to the Court at 30-day intervals.  

Court refers the defendant to the Outpaitent Competency Restoration Program.  Court STAYS the committment to 5-8-15 at 10:00 a.m.  Status conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Report by Deborah Collins dated 4-17-15 received and filed./ds

Defendant Mareill Harris in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has not received all discovery.  Attorney Wasielewski has reason to doubt defendant's competency and moves for an examination.  Court grant motion and orders defendant to be examined by the Forensic Unit.  Court suspends the proceedings.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mareill Harris in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defense moved to dismiss the complaint due to lack of probable cause.  Arguements heard. Motion to dismiss denied. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. 
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mareill Harris in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Mareill Harris in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
